welcome.description: Capture, validate, transform, and route data — from any form, script, or AI agent.
welcome.subDescription: Lightning-fast, privacy-first, and built to keep your data flowing securely and simply.

noFields.title: No Fields Required
noFields.description: Send any form data—even without predefined fields. Customize validations and transformations only when you need them.

flexible.title: Flexible Form Creation
flexible.description: Build forms with our intuitive GUI or simple TOML configs. Embed, link, or create fully custom forms — effortlessly.

protection.title: Smart Spam & Captcha Protection
protection.description: Friendly, automated CAPTCHA challenges keep your submissions clean without frustrating your users.

privacy.title: Privacy by Design
privacy.description: Your data stays yours. We don't collect personal info, with secure EU hosting focused on your privacy and trust.

integrations.title: Seamless Integrations
integrations.description: Connect instantly with email notifications, webhooks, and more — keeping your workflows flowing smoothly.

pricing.title: Simple, Transparent Pricing
pricing.description: Start at just €0.005 per submission or self-host for €590/year. No hidden fees, no investors, no upsells.

cta.title: Ready to bring your forms to life?
cta.description: No complex onboarding — just seamless form data handling.
cta.loginDescription: Already part of the Formshive family? Log in to manage your forms.

forms.title: Form Title
forms.redirectDescription: The URL to which the user will be redirected after form submission.
forms.redirectWarning: If you do not set a redirect URL, users will see a blank page after submission. This is only recommended, if you know what you're doing (for ex. handle the submission with Javascript).
forms.filterSpamDescription: Enable SPAM filtering. This will check for common spam patterns using field specifications. Integration and notifications are skipped for SPAM submissions.
forms.filterSpamWarning: Form submissions will be rejected if the form does not contain a field with the name "message" in your form, or a custom field with spam check enabled.
forms.captchaDescription: Enable Captcha verification. This will require the user to solve a captcha before submitting the form.
forms.captchaWarning: Form submissions will be rejected if the captcha is not solved.
forms.createDescription: You can configure integrations and email notifications after saving.
forms.formsDescription: Forms trough which you receive messages.
forms.spamFilterEnabled: Spam filter is enabled. Make sure to include a field with the name "message" in your form, or a form field with spam check enabled.

integrations.description: Use Webhooks to integrate with Zapier and others
integrations.createDescription: At the moment only webhooks are supported.

messages.description: All incoming messages will be listed here.

billing.usageDescription: We charge by usage, not month; Need 10 messages per year? No problem.
billing.emailNotifications: Receive email notifications about each message (~0.003 Euro)

formSpec.checkFormFieldsDescription: Check form fields for errors before submission.
formSpec.formFieldsDisabled: Form fields are not enabled and won't have any effect.
formSpec.spamFilterEnabled: Spam filter is enabled. Make sure to include a field with the name
formSpec.spamFilterEnabledWithField: Spam filter is enabled and will check the field
formSpec.spamFilterEnabledNoField: Spam filter is enabled but no field has spam checking configured. Add a field with spam checking enabled to use this feature.
formSpec.unsavedChangesAlert: Unsaved changes: Save changes before changing editor.

editor.selectFieldToEdit: Select a field to edit its settings, or configure global form settings below.
editor.discardAdditionalFieldsDescription: Discard additional fields that are not defined in the form specification.
editor.noFieldsAdded: No fields added yet. Use the buttons on the left to add your first field.
editor.fieldNameExists: A field with this name already exists. Please choose a different name.

accountPages.formsDescription: Forms trough which you receive messages.
accountPages.integrationsDescription: Use Webhooks to integrate with Zapier and others
accountPages.messagesDescription: All incoming messages will be listed here.

formEdit.generalDescription: Form title, redirect URL, spam filter and captcha.
formEdit.formFieldsDescription: Form fields are things like first name, last name, email adress, etc. With form fields you can do form validation, data transformation, and generate HTML forms.
formEdit.emailNotificationsDescription: Forward incoming messages to one or more email addresses.
formEdit.integrationsDescription: Forward incoming messages to other services using integrations.

formIntegration.manualDescription: Already have an HTML form? Simply point your form's action to the Formshive URL below. If you've enabled captcha, include the captcha URL too.
formIntegration.formUrlDescription: Your form can receive both form and JSON submissions, for integration on websites as well as usage in bash scripts and others.
formIntegration.captchaDescription: This URL is used to verify the captcha.
formIntegration.captchaDisabledDescription: This URL is used to verify the captcha. (Disabled because you have not enabled Captcha)
formIntegration.examplesFromFields: Examples were generated from the form fields.
formIntegration.fileUploadNote: Most forms will work as is, but with file uploads you have to take special care to include
formIntegration.formSubmissionCurlFile: Form submission with curl, including file upload
formIntegration.fileUploadCurlNote: Most submissions will work as is, but with file uploads you have to take special care to include
formIntegration.redirectNotApplicable: The redirect url is not applicable to JSON-formatted submissions.
formIntegration.embedDescription: Embed your Formshive form into any website with JavaScript. Perfect for Squarespace, WordPress, or custom sites. Copy the code and paste it into your page.
formIntegration.iframeDescription: Display your Formshive form using an iFrame. Grab the embed code below and paste it into your website's HTML for a seamless inline form.
formIntegration.linkDescriptionLong: Share your Formshive form with a direct link. Copy the URL below and use it in emails, social media, or as a button on your website.
formIntegration.needFormFieldsEmbedFeature: You need to create and enable form fields to use the embed feature.
formIntegration.needFormFieldsIframeFeature: You need to create and enable form fields to use the iframe feature.
formIntegration.needFormFieldsLinkFeature: You need to create and enable form fields to use the link feature
formIntegration.noFileField: The form does not include a file upload field.
formIntegration.htmlTagDescription: Place this tag in the HTML where you want the form to appear.
formIntegration.scriptTagDescription: Place this where you want the form to appear.
formIntegration.linkDescription: Use this URL to link directly to the form.
formIntegration.formTitleDescription: Custom title displayed on the form page

specField.optionsDescription: Press Enter to add an option
specField.fieldNameDescription: Used internally for form data. Use lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores only.
specField.onValidationFailureDescription: What happens if the field validation fails?
specField.checkSpamDescription: Enable spam checking for this field. Only one field per form can have spam checking enabled.
specField.optionsNote: * Options are only applicable to html output and do not impact validation.
